pullRequest.title: Slightly tune github issue templates
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 User relevant changes are recorded in CHANGES.txt
 Touched code is covered by tests
 Documentation has been updated if necessary
 CLA is signed
 This does not contain breaking changes, or if it does:

It is released within a major release
It is recorded in CHANGES.txt
It was marked as deprecated in an earlier release if possible
You've thought about the consequences and other components are adapted
(E.g. AdminUI)

(this may need re-wrapping)

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -31,14 +31,18 @@ If using docker:
 **Problem description**:
 
 <!-- 
-Please be precise about errors. Instead of saying "doesn't work" or "fails",
-describe the behavior you're observing and what you'd expect to see.
+Please don't say "doesn't work" but instead write a precise description of the
+behavior you observe and explain what behavior you'd expect.
 
-Include relevant logs and error messages or stacktraces if possible.
+If a query returns an error message, please include the error message and a
+stacktrace of the error.  To get the stack trace either run the query in crash
+with \verbose on, or run it in the AdminUI Console with `[x] Show error trace`
+set.
 
-If there are memory issues please provide the garbage collection log file if
-possible.
+If a query doesn't return an error but behaves in an unexpected way, please

nodes.bodyText: would change this to active voice, e.g., "If you are experiencing performance issues, ..."
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -31,14 +31,18 @@ If using docker:
 **Problem description**:
 
 <!-- 
-Please be precise about errors. Instead of saying "doesn't work" or "fails",
-describe the behavior you're observing and what you'd expect to see.
+Please don't say "doesn't work" but instead write a precise description of the
+behavior you observe and explain what behavior you'd expect.
 
-Include relevant logs and error messages or stacktraces if possible.
+If a query returns an error message, please include the error message and a
+stacktrace of the error.  To get the stack trace either run the query in crash
+with \verbose on, or run it in the AdminUI Console with `[x] Show error trace`
+set.
 
-If there are memory issues please provide the garbage collection log file if
-possible.
+If a query doesn't return an error but behaves in an unexpected way, please
+include the server logs.
 
+If there are performance issues, please provide the garbage collection logs.

commit.message: Add hints for stacktrace inclusion in issue template
Add triage label to feature request template

beforeCommit.message: Add triage label to feature request template

afterCommit.message: Add triage label to feature request template
